module.name: Forms
module.short: Contains definitions and descriptions for constructing the Forms which are the basis of the Lazarus Graphical User Interface

element.name: TPosition
element.short: Represents the Position and Size on Screen of an Form

descr.p: poDesigned - The Form appears exactly as it is positioned and sized in the Form Designer
poDefault - The window manager decides how the form is to appear, in a default position and size
poDefaultPosOnly - keeps the Designed size, but position determined by windowmanager
poDefaultSizeOnly - keeps the Designed position, but size determined by windowmanager
poScreenCenter - Centers the form on screen
poDeskTopCenter - Centers the form on desktop
poMainFormCenter - Centers the Form on the Main Form
poOwnerFormCenter - Centers the Form on Owner form

element.name: TWindowState
element.short: Represents the actual State of the window on the screen.

descr.p:
The actual meaning of each value depends on the platform:
Windows and Mac OS X - These operating systems support all values.
X11 - The window state is a hint sent to the Window Manager, so more primitive Window Managers might ignore this hints.
Windows CE - In Windows CE platforms where Application.ApplicationType = atKeyPadDevice or atPDA (like in Windows Phone, PocketPC and Windows Mobile), wsMinimized and wsNormal are understood as wsMaximized, which is the normal state for windows in this platform. An exception are windows with BorderStyle=bsDialog or bsNone, which are allowed to have a custom position and size. For more information please read http://wiki.lazarus.freepascal.org/Windows_CE_Development_Notes#Positioning_and_size_of_Dialogs_and_Forms
Android - In this platform windows are always fullscreen.
The valid values for this enumerated type are:
wsNormal - The window appears normal
wsMinimized - The window is minimized and is not shown in the screen, but only in the taskbar
wsMaximized - The window appears maximized
wsFullScreen - The window appears in full screen mode, as much as allowed by the platform.

element.name: TScrollingWinControl
element.short: TScrollingWinControl - a class of Window Control that has one or more scroll bars
element.descr: Scrolling Window Control: A window control with scroll bars. An ancestor class for many forms with scrolling windows

element.name: TCustomHintAction
element.short: TCustomHintAction - Base class for THintAction, the action for displaying a Hint

element.name: EScrollBar
element.short: Exception in Scroll Bar
element.descr: Exception class for Scroll Bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar
element.short: TControlScrollBar - base class for defining scroll bars on Forms and windows
element.descr:
Control Scroll Bar: Scroll Bar control for adding to windows. Can be horizontal or vertical.
This is an ancestor class for many form types and classes of windowed controls

element.name: TControlScrollBar.FControl
element.short: FControl - local variable to hold the Window Control to which the scroll bar belongs

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ControlAutoScroll
element.short: ControlAutoScroll - returns True if the control can Auto-Scroll

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ControlHandle
element.short: ControlHandle - the operating system handle for this control

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetIncrement
element.short: GetIncrement - returns the size of the increment for each slick in the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetPage
element.short: GetPage - returns the size of the Page-Down (or -Up) Increment for the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetPosition
element.short: GetPosition returns the position of the slider in the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetRange
element.short: GetRange - returns the valid range of values for the scroll bar movement

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetSize
element.short: GetSize - returns the size of the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetSmooth
element.short: GetSmooth - returns True if smooth scrolling is to be used

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetVisible
element.short: GetVisible - returns True if the scroll bar is visible

element.name: TControlScrollBar.HandleAllocated
element.short: HandleAllocated - returns True if a handle has been allocated

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SmoothIsStored
element.short: SmoothIsStored - returns True if the Smooth status has been stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.VisibleIsStored
element.short: VisibleIsStored - returns True if the Visible status has been stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.AutoCalcRange
element.short: AutoCalcRange - method for automatically calculating the range of values for the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ControlUpdateScrollBars
element.short: ControlUpdateScrollBars - method to be used by the owner control for updating its scrollbars

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollHandler
element.short: ScrollHandler - message handler to control scrolling

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetIncrement
element.short: SetIncrement - specifies the scrolling increment

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetPage
element.short: SetPage - specifies the page scrolling increment

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetPosition
element.short: SetPosition - specifies the position of the slider in the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetRange
element.short: SetRange - specifies the range of values for the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetSize
element.short: SetSize - specifies the size of the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetSmooth
element.short: SetSmooth - specifies whether smooth scrolling is to be used

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetVisible
element.short: SetVisible - specifies whether the scroll bar is to be visible

element.name: TControlScrollBar.UpdateScrollBar
element.short: UpdateScrollBar - method to update the scroll bar (position etc)

element.name: TControlScrollBar.InvalidateScrollInfo
element.short: InvalidateScrollInfo - method to render scroll information non-valid

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TControlScrollBar: performs inherited Create then initialises local flags for page, increment, position etc

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create.AControl
element.short: The identity of the windowed control in which the scroll bar is found

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create.AKind
element.short: Whether this is a horizontal or a vertical scrollbar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Assign
element.short: Assign - if Source is a TControlScrollBar, copies properties to itself, else performs inherited Assign
element.descr: Assigns the contents of the source object to the current object; in particular finds the increment, position, range and whether smooth scrolling is to be feature and whether the scroll bar is visible

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Assign.Source
element.short: The object that called this instance of the class

element.name: TControlScrollBar.IsScrollBarVisible
element.short: Visibility of scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.IsScrollBarVisible.Result
element.short: Returns 'True' if scroll bar visible

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollPos
element.short: Position of the indicator cursor on the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollPos.Result
element.short: Returns position of the scroll cursor as an integer

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Kind
element.short: Finds which kind of scroll bar this is: horizontal or vertical
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine which kind of scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetOtherScrollBar
element.short: Finds out details of the other scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetOtherScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns a link to the details of the other scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetHorzScrollBar
element.short: GetHorzScrollBar - find the position and properties of the horizontal scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetHorzScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns details of the horizontal scroll bar as a pointer to a structure

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetVertScrollBar
element.short: GetVertScrollBar - find the position and properties of the vertical scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetVertScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns details of the vertical scroll bar as a pointer to a structure

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Size
element.short: Determine the size of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the size; by default the size is not stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Increment
element.short: The size of the scrolling increment
element.descr:
The amount by which the scroll indicator moves if the triangle at either end of the bar is selected.
Read or write a flag to determine the increment, an integer with a default value of 8 (pixels)

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Page
element.short: The size of the paging increment for scrolling
element.descr:
The amount by which the scroll indicator moves if the cursor selects the scroll bar above, below or on either side of the scroll indicator.
Reads or writes a flag to determine paging increment; default value is 80 pixels

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Smooth
element.short: Determine whether smooth scrolling is to be implemented
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine smooth scrolling, and sets a flag is the scrolling status is stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Position
element.short: Position of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag with the position; default is zero

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Range
element.short: The range (extent) of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the range; default is zero

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Visible
element.short: Can the scroll bar be made visible?
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine visibility, and sets a flag if the property is stored. The Handle object (widget) is made visible if (Visible=true) and (Range>Page). To get the current visible state of the widget use the method IsScrollBarVisible.

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.AlignControls
element.short: AlignControls - calls inherited AlignControls, then calculates sizes for the scrollbars if required

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.CreateWnd
element.short: CreateWnd - performs inherited CreateWnd then updates ScrollBars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.GetClientScrollOffset
element.short: GetClientScrollOffset - finds the position for scrollbars from the client, if any, otherwise sets default postiions

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.GetLogicalClientRect
element.short: GetLogicalClientRect - adjusts client rect to allow for size of scrollbars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.DoOnResize
element.short: DoOnResize - performs inherited DoOnResize then updates scrollbars if needed

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: GetControlClassDefaultSize inserts its own defaults, overriding inherited values

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.WMHScroll
element.short: WMHScroll - system message method for horizontal scrolling

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.WMVScroll
element.short: WMVScroll - system message method for vertical scroling

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.ScrollBy
element.short: ScrollBy - amount by which to scroll

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.ComputeScrollbars
element.short: ComputeScrollbars - returns True if scroll bar positions need to be computed

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.ScrollbarHandler
element.short: ScrollbarHandler - method for handling scroll bars of specified kind at specified position

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.Loaded
element.short: Loaded - calls inherited Loaded and updates scroll bars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.Create
element.descr: This constructor can override the constructor of an ancestor class
element.short: Create - constructor for TScrollingWinControl: performs inherited Create then creates and intiialises the scrollbars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.Destroy
element.descr: Can override destructor of parent class
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TScrollingWinControl: frees the horizontal and vertical scrollbars, then performs inherited Destroy

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.UpdateScrollbars
element.short: Update the position of the scroll indicatores in the scroll bars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.HasVisibleScrollbars
element.short: Whether the scroll bars are visible

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.AutoScroll
element.short: Does auto-scrolling apply?
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine auto-scrolling

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.HorzScrollBar
element.short: The properties of the horizontal scroll bar

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.VertScrollBar
element.short: The properties of the vertical scroll bar

element.name: TScrollBox
element.short: Scroll Box: A box with scroll bars

element.name: TCustomFrame
element.short: TCustomFrame - the base type for TFrame

element.name: TCustomFrame.GetChildren
element.short: GetChildren - calls inherited GetChildren then accepts ownership of all owned components that have no parent

element.name: TCustomFrame.Notification
element.short: Notification calls inherited Notification then add or removes the component's action list (depending on what Operation specifies)

element.name: TCustomFrame.SetParent
element.short: SetParent - calls inherited Setparent after validity checks, then updates the action lists

element.name: TCustomFrame.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: GetControlClassDefaultSize - returns its own defaults for frame design, overriding the inherited values

element.name: TCustomFrame.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomFrame: performs inherited Create then initialises styles, bounds etc

element.name: TCustomFrameClass
element.short: TCustomFrameClass - class of TCustomFrame

element.name: TFrame
element.short: TFrame - a container for all the other components on a form, or for a group of components within a form

element.name: TIDesigner
element.short: TIDesigner - a class describing a Form Designer

element.name: TBorderIcon
element.short: TBorderIcon - enumerated type to specify which icon appears on the top border of the Form
element.descr:
biSystemMenu - The form has a System menu (Maybe not all windowmanager supports this)
biMinimize - The form has an minimize button
biMaximize - The form has a maximize button
biHelp - When you click this button a Question Cursor appears and the help routines are called if you click on an control

element.name: TBorderIcons
element.short: TBorderIcons - set of TBorderIcon; the group of icons to appear at the top of the form

element.name: TFormStateType
element.short: TFormStateType - enumerated type to describe the state of a form; whether it is being created or destroyed, its visibility, whether Modal etc

descr.p: The valid states are:
descr.pre: fsCreating, // initializing (form streaming) fsVisible, // form should be shown fsShowing, fsModal, // form is modal fsCreatedMDIChild, fsBorderStyleChanged, fsFormStyleChanged, fsFirstShow, // form is shown for the first time fsDisableAutoSize

element.name: TFormState
element.short: TFormState - the set of form states that apply to this form

element.name: TModalResult
element.short: TModalResult - the range of values that can be returned as a modal result
element.descr: TModalResult represents the value returned by a modal dialog. Even though the type is defined as an integer, instead a few standard constants are used as return results in applications.

element.name: TCustomForm
element.short: TCustomForm - the base type for TForm

element.name: TCustomForm.FFormBorderStyle
element.short: FFormBorderStyle - local variable to hold style of border

element.name: TCustomForm.FActionLists
element.short: FActionLists - local variable holding lists of actions asociated with the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.CMShowingChanged
element.short: CMShowingChanged - system message method for showing if the form has changed

element.name: TCustomForm.Activate
element.short: Activate - method for rendering the Form active

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveChanged
element.short: ActiveChanged - method for a form that is active and changed

element.name: TCustomForm.BeginFormUpdate
element.short: BeginFormUpdate - start updating the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.CreateParams
element.short: CreateParams calls inherited CreateParams, and specifically copies style from parent

element.name: TCustomForm.CreateWnd
element.short: CreateWnd calls inherited CreateWnd, signals if a handle is required and attaches a menu to the window if one does not yet exist; activates focus if visible

element.name: TCustomForm.Deactivate
element.short: Deactivate - method for rendering the Form inactive

element.name: TCustomForm.DoClose
element.short: DoClose - close the Form using the specified CloseAction

element.name: TCustomForm.DoCreate
element.short: DoCreate - perform the Create action

element.name: TCustomForm.DoDestroy
element.short: DoDestroy- perform the Destroy action

element.name: TCustomForm.DoHide
element.short: DoHide - method for hiding a previously visible object

element.name: TCustomForm.DoShow
element.short: DoShow - method to redender visible a previously hidden form

element.name: TCustomForm.EndFormUpdate
element.short: EndFormUpdate - finish updating the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.GetChildren
element.short: GetChildren calls inherited GetChildren then takes ownership of all components, including those without parents

element.name: TCustomForm.Loaded
element.short: Loaded - calls inherited Loaded, makes this the active control and gives it focus

element.name: TCustomForm.ChildHandlesCreated
element.short: ChildHandlesCreated - method for use when handles have been created for descendants

element.name: TCustomForm.Notification
element.short: Notification calls inherited Notification then add or removes the component's action list (depending on what Operation specifies)

element.name: TCustomForm.SetZOrder
element.short: SetZOrder - set the Z order for the Form; if Topmost is True, Form is on top of all other objects

element.name: TCustomForm.UpdateShowing
element.short: UpdateShowing - method to update the Visible property

element.name: TCustomForm.DoFirstShow
element.short: DoFirstShow - perform the first Show action since creation of the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.UpdateWindowState
element.short: UpdateWindowState - update the state of the Window displaying the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.VisibleChanging
element.short: VisibleChanging - method for dealing with a Form whose Visible property is changing

element.name: TCustomForm.WndProc
element.short: WndProc - performs actions specific to the message then calls inherited WndProc

descr.p: WndProc - performs actions specific to the message then calls inherited WndProc
Specific messages include:
Activate, SetFocus. KillFocus; Exit, Enter; Window Position Changing; Draw Item

element.name: TCustomForm.VisibleIsStored
element.short: VisibleIsStored - True if the Visible property has been stored

element.name: TCustomForm.GetDefaultDockCaption
element.short: GetDefaultDockCaption - returns the default caption to be used for docking

element.name: TCustomForm.CMActionExecute
element.short: CMActionExecute - system message method for executing action

element.name: TCustomForm.CMActionUpdate
element.short: CMActionUpdate - system message method for updating action

element.name: TCustomForm.DoExecuteAction
element.short: Asks every visible control to Execute the specified action ExeAction.

descr.p: DoExecuteAction asks every visible control to Execute the specified action ExeAction. If some control executes it and returns true, then the traversal of visible components is stopped. All child controls (and its children etc) are queried too.
For example you have
then the following controls are queried in this order: TPanel, TButton, TCheckBox, TMemo.
But first of all, the Form itself and the ActiveControl are asked to execute the given action.

element.name: TCustomForm.DoExecuteAction.Result
element.short: True, if any control handles the action.

element.name: TCustomForm.DoExecuteAction.ExeAction
element.short: Action to execute.

element.name: TCustomForm.DoUpdateAction
element.short: DoUpdateAction - asks all visible controls to update the specified action

element.name: TCustomForm.UpdateActions
element.short: UpdateActions - method for updating actions

element.name: TCustomForm.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomForm: checks for correct ClassType, looks for required resources then creates the Form
element.descr: This constructor can override the constructor of an ancestor class

element.name: TCustomForm.CreateNew
element.short: CreateNew - constructor for creating a completely new form

element.name: TCustomForm.BeforeDestruction
element.short: BeforeDestruction - method to be applied before Form is destroyed (usually involves clean-up)

element.name: TCustomForm.GetIconHandle
element.short: Find the handle for the Icon

element.name: TCustomForm.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomForm: frees all menus, icons, actionlists, screens and handlers, then performs inherited Destroy

element.name: TCustomForm.CloseQuery
element.short: Is the associated query to be closed?

element.name: TCustomForm.Release
element.short: Set free the resources of the form

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowOnTop
element.short: Shows this form as the top (nearest) item of any stack of windows or images.

element.name: TCustomForm.EnsureVisible
element.short: Ensure that this form is always visible, if necessary moving it to the top (front) of the stack of images

element.name: TCustomForm.WantChildKey
element.short: WantChildKey - returns True if the specified child control requires a key (Message)

element.name: TCustomForm.DefocusControl
element.short: DefocusControl - withdraws focus from the specified control, removing it if required

element.name: TCustomForm.SetFocusedControl
element.short: SetFocusedControl - method for giving focus to specified control; returns True if successful

element.name: TCustomForm.FocusControl
element.short: FocusControl - giving focus to specified control, automatically bringing form to front
element.errors: If the control or one of its parents is not visible or disabled an exception will be raised.

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowModal
element.short: Show this form as modal - ie control cannot be resumed by another form until the current form is closed

element.name: TCustomForm.SetRestoredBounds
element.short: SetRestoredBounds - set the bounds defining the position of the restored control

element.name: TCustomForm.GetRolesForControl
element.short: GetRolesForControl - returns a set of roles (default, cancel) for the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerFirstShow
element.short: AddHandlerFirstShow - perform the action for adding a handler at the time of first showing

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerFirstShow
element.short: RemoveHandlerFirstShow - perform the action for removing the handler on the first showing

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerClose
element.short: AddHandlerClose - adds a handler for closing Form

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerClose
element.short: RemoveHandlerClose - removes handler for closing form

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerCreate
element.short: AddHandlerCreate - performs the OnCreateHandler event

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerCreate
element.short: RemoveHandlerCreate - removes the handler for the Create event

element.name: TCustomForm.IsShortcut
element.short: IsShortcut - if True, the specified Key and Message are active as a shortcut

element.name: TCustomForm.IntfDropFiles
element.short: IntfDropFiles - Invokes OnDropFilesEvent of the form. This function is called by the interface.

element.name: TCustomForm.IntfHelp
element.short: IntfHelp - Show help for control or menu item. This function is called by the interface.

element.name: TCustomForm.Active
element.short: Is true when the form has the focus
element.descr: Use active to check if the form has the focus

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveControl
element.short: Specifies the active control on the form
element.descr: Use this to get or set the active control on this form

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveDefaultControl
element.short: Specifies the active default control on the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.AllowDropFiles
element.short: Specifies if files are allowed to be dropped on this form.
element.descr: Set AllowDropFiles event to True to allow dropping files on this form. It is set to False by default.

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderIcons
element.short: Specifies which icons appear on the top of the form
element.descr:
Use bordericons flags to get or set the icons that appear on the top border of the form.
By default we see down-triangle or other generic icon on the left,
which activates a pop-up system menu allowing closure or re-sizing of the form,
and on the right end we see the minimise and re-size/maximise buttons,
but of course these can be customised by the application programmer.

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderStyle
element.short: The border style for this Form

descr.p: Use borderstyle to get or set the appearance of the form's border.
By default it is a sizeable window, but it could, for example, be a dialog form or a tool window, or could be non-sizeable

This property is slightly different (has a differert base type) from the TCustomControl.BorderStyle When the form is put into another control the window borders depend on the widgetset. There are no borders under gtk.

element.name: TCustomForm.CancelControl
element.short: The control associated with the cancel action

descr.p: Determines the control associated with the Cancel action (exit from the control without changing anything).
This is usually a button with the caption 'Cancel', but might be an 'Exit' button or anything else the application programmer decides.
This control is selected either by explicitly clicking with the mouse, or by hitting the 'Esc' key

element.name: TCustomForm.Color
element.descr: The form's colour; by default it is the same as the colour specified for button faces.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefaultControl
element.short: The control associated with the default action for this form
element.descr:
Reads or sets a flag determining the default control.
This is typically a button such as 'Accept' which is highlighted in some way on-screen to indicate that this is the default action, and is selected either by hitting 'Return' or 'Enter' or by selecting that control with the mouse

element.name: TCustomForm.FormState
element.short: Determines the state of the form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the form's state:
is it being created, is this its first showing, is the border style being changed, etc.
FormState is a set, so could take zero or more of possible values.

element.name: TCustomForm.FormStyle
element.short: Determinates the style of the form

descr.p: Reads or writes flag to determine the style of the form.
Default is 'normal', but could be MDIChild or MDINormal, could stay on top or could be a 'Splash' form.
FormStyle is a set, so could take zero or more of these values.

element.name: TCustomForm.HelpFile
element.short: Specifies the help file that is used by the form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine identity of Help file,
and to determine whether its name is stored.
Property contains filename as a string.

element.name: TCustomForm.Icon
element.short: The Icon associated with this Form (which may appear in menus, directories, ListBoxes etc)

element.name: TCustomForm.KeyPreview
element.short: KeyPreview - if True, Key Preview is possible

element.name: TCustomForm.Menu
element.short: Specifies a MainMenu for this form
element.descr: Drop a TMainMenu on the form and select it here to show it on the form.

element.name: TCustomForm.ModalResult
element.short: Specifies the return value of an modal form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine whether there is a modal resut.
If the form is modal, returns an integer value.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnActivate
element.short: Event called when the form receives focus
element.descr: This method is called when the form receives focus for the first time at application start up and then subsequently each time focus is changed from another window of the same application to this window. For focus changes between different applications the event Application.OnActivate is called instead.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnClose
element.short: Event handler for closing the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnCloseQuery
element.short: Event handler for closing the query associated with the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnCreate
element.short: Event handler for creating the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDeactivate
element.short: Event handler for deactivating the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDestroy
element.short: Event handler when the form is being destroyed

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDropFiles
element.short: The event invoked when file is dropped on this form.
element.descr: The OnDropFiles event is invoked when user drops one or multiple files on this form. You enable this feature by setting AllowDropFiles property.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnHelp
element.short: Event handler when Help is required

element.name: TCustomForm.OnHide
element.short: Event handler if form is being hidden

element.name: TCustomForm.OnShortcut
element.short: Event handler if shortcut key is pressed

element.name: TCustomForm.OnShow
element.short: Event handler if form is to be shown

element.name: TCustomForm.OnWindowStateChange
element.short: Event handler for a change in the window state

element.name: TCustomForm.PixelsPerInch
element.short: The scaling of the form in absolute terms

descr.p: Reads or writes a flag to determine the scaling factor (a longinteger).
Not normally stored locally

element.name: TCustomForm.Position
element.short: The position of the form on the screen
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine screen position of form.
By default it is in the position that it was placed in the Form Designer

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredLeft
element.short: The position of the left edge of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredTop
element.short: The position of the top edge of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredWidth
element.short: The width of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredHeight
element.short: The height of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowInTaskBar
element.short: Should the form be shown in the system Task Bar?

element.name: TCustomForm.Visible
element.descr: Set or get this to set the form visible/hidden or get the status of the form

element.name: TCustomForm.WindowState
element.short: Represents how the form appears on the screen
element.descr:
Reads or write flag to determine state of the window on screen.
Default is 'normal' (ie not minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomFormClass
element.short: TCustomFormClass - class of TCustomForm

element.name: TForm.ClientHandle
element.short: The operating system handle for the client

element.name: TForm.ActiveControl
element.descr: Use active control to set or get the control that has the focus on this form

element.name: TFormClass
element.short: TFormClass - class of TForm

element.name: TCustomDockForm
element.short: TCustomDockForm - Base class for docking forms

element.name: TCustomDockForm.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomDockForm: performs CreateNew then initialises autoscroll and style properties

element.name: THintWindow
element.short: Hint Window - the popup box containing helpful information that appears when the mouse pointer hovers over an object

element.name: THintWindow.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for THintWindow: performs inherited Create then initialises many properties including timers, styles, position, font and colour

element.name: THintWindow.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for THintWindow: frees timers then performs inherited Destroy

element.name: THintWindow.ActivateHint
element.short: Allow the hint message to be displayed in the specified rectangular space

element.name: THintWindow.ActivateHintData
element.short: Allow the hint message to be displayed, with a pointer to further data

element.name: THintWindow.CalcHintRect
element.short: Work out the size of the rectangle required to display the specified hint message

element.name: THintWindow.ReleaseHandle
element.short: Release the handle for the hint message and return it to the system

element.name: THintWindow.AutoHide
element.short: Does the hint disappear (get hidden) after a while?
element.descr: If AutoHide is TRUE, the hint disappears afer an interval specified by HideInterval

element.name: THintWindow.HideInterval
element.short: The time after which the displayed hint disappears

element.name: THintWindowClass
element.short: THintWindowClass - class of THintWindow

element.name: TScreen
element.short: Screen - the visible area

descr.short: Specifies which style the form border has

element.name: TScreen.GetHintFont
element.short: GetHintFont - find the correct font for displaying Hints

element.name: TScreen.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TScreen: performs inherited Create then creates and initialises lists of fonts, strings and forms

element.name: TScreen.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TForm: frees various lists then performs inherited Destroy

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormIndex
element.short: The Index number of a Custom Form on the screen

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormIndex.Result
element.short: The Index number of the Custom Form, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormIndex.AForm
element.short: The Custom Form to which the Index refers

element.name: TScreen.FormIndex
element.short: The index number of a Form on the Screen

element.name: TScreen.FormIndex.Result
element.short: The index number of the Form, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.FormIndex.AForm
element.short: The Form to which the Index refers

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormZIndex
element.short: CustomFormZIndex - the index value of the form in the Z dimension (Front to Back)

element.name: TScreen.MoveFormToFocusFront
element.short: MoveFormToFocusFront - move the specified form to the front of the focus

element.name: TScreen.MoveFormToZFront
element.short: MoveFormToZFront - move form to front in the Z-plane (does not specify whether focused)

element.name: TScreen.GetCurrentModalForm
element.short: GetCurrentModalForm - returns the current Modal form on the current screen (ie a form that is awaiting a user response)

element.name: TScreen.GetCurrentModalFormZIndex
element.short: GetCurrentModalFormZIndex - returns the Z-plane index of the current modal form

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormBelongsToActiveGroup
element.short: CustomFormBelongsToActiveGroup - returns True if the specified form belongs to the active group

element.name: TScreen.FindForm
element.short: FindForm - returns the form with the specified name

element.name: TScreen.UpdateScreen
element.short: Method for updating screen

element.name: TScreen.AddHandlerFormAdded
element.short: AddHandlerFormAdded - method for adding a form-adding handler

element.name: TScreen.RemoveHandlerFormAdded
element.short: RemoveHandlerFormAdded - method for removing a form-adding handler

element.name: TScreen.AddHandlerRemoveForm
element.short: AddHandlerRemoveForm - method for adding a form-removing handler

element.name: TScreen.RemoveHandlerRemoveForm
element.short: RemoveHandlerRemoveForm - method for removing a form-removing handler

element.name: TScreen.AddHandlerActiveControlChanged
element.short: AddHandlerActiveControlChanged - method for adding a handler for a change in the active control

element.name: TScreen.RemoveHandlerActiveControlChanged
element.short: RemoveHandlerActiveControlChanged - method for removing a handler for a change in the active control

element.name: TScreen.AddHandlerActiveFormChanged
element.short: AddHandlerActiveFormChanged - method for adding a handler for a change in active form

element.name: TScreen.RemoveHandlerActiveFormChanged
element.short: RemoveHandlerActiveFormChanged - method for removing a handler for a change in active form

element.name: TScreen.ActiveControl
element.short: The identity of the active control on this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the active control

element.name: TScreen.ActiveCustomForm
element.short: The identity of the active Custom Form on this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the active Custom Form

element.name: TScreen.ActiveForm
element.short: The identity of the active Form on this Screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the active Form

element.name: TScreen.Cursor
element.short: The cursor currently being used in this screen
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the cursor.
This can take any integer value, but there are several pre-determined cursor styles
listed as constants in 'Controls',
and these should be used to define the cursor for the current screen

element.name: TScreen.Cursors
element.short: The indexed list of available cursors for this screen

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormCount
element.short: The number of Custom Forms on this screen
element.descr: Reads flag to determine number of Custom Forms (integer)

element.name: TScreen.CustomForms
element.short: The list of Custom Forms on the screen

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormZOrderCount
element.short: CustomFormZOrderCount - the number of forms arranged in Z-plane order (ie Front to Back)

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormsZOrdered
element.short: CustomFormsZOrdered - the forms arranged in Z-plane order (ie Front to Back)

element.name: TScreen.DesktopHeight
element.short: The total available height of the desktop in which the screen is to be placed

element.name: TScreen.DesktopWidth
element.short: The total available width of the desktop in which the screen is to be placed

element.name: TScreen.FocusedForm
element.short: FocusedForm - the form that holds Focus

element.name: TScreen.FormCount
element.short: The number of Forms on this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the number of Forms (integer)

element.name: TScreen.Forms
element.short: The list of Forms in this Screen

element.name: TScreen.Forms.Index
element.short: Index number of a Form, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.Fonts
element.short: The fonts to be used in this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the fonts to be used; their names are stored as a list of strings

element.name: TScreen.Height
element.short: The height of the screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine screen height; stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.HintFont
element.short: The font to be used to display hints
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the font to be used (font name stored as a string)

element.name: TScreen.Width
element.short: The width of the screen
element.descr: Reads flag to determine screen width, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.OnActiveControlChange
element.short: Event handler for change in the active control

element.name: TScreen.OnActiveFormChange
element.short: Event handler for a change in the active form on the screen

element.name: TScreen.PixelsPerInch
element.short: Scaling factor for displaying graphic information on the screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine number of pixels per inch (integer)

element.name: TApplication
element.short: TApplication - the whole current program, described as an object

descr.p: TApplication - the whole current program, described as an object.
Includes the useful function MessageBox, a simple dialog intended for displaying error messages internally, but available as an alternative to the various Message Dialogs

element.name: TApplication.RunLoop
element.short: Make the application run in a loop, ie it starts again when it has finished

element.name: TApplication.GetConsoleApplication
element.short: GetConsoleApplication - returns True if this is a Console application (ie text-mode, non-GUI)

element.name: TApplication.NotifyIdleHandler
element.short: NotifyIdleHandler - method for sending message to Idle handler (sends True if process is done)

element.name: TApplication.NotifyIdleEndHandler
element.short: NotifyIdleEndHandler - method for sending message to handler for end of idle state

element.name: TApplication.NotifyActivateHandler
element.short: NotifyActivateHandler - method for sending message to handler for activation

element.name: TApplication.NotifyDeactivateHandler
element.short: NotifyDeactivateHandler - method for sending message to handler for deactivation

element.name: TApplication.IsHintMsg
element.short: IsHintMsg - returns True if specified message is a valid Hint

element.name: TApplication.DoOnMouseMove
element.short: DoOnMouseMove - method for the OnMouseMove event

element.name: TApplication.ShowHintWindow
element.short: ShowHintWindow - method for showing a hint window

element.name: TApplication.OnHintTimer
element.short: OnHintTimer - event handler for timing the duration of hints

element.name: TApplication.SetTitle
element.short: SetTitle - method for writing the specified title string to local store

element.name: TApplication.StartHintTimer
element.short: StartHintTimer - method for starting the timer for display of a hint message

element.name: TApplication.UpdateVisible
element.short: UpdateVisible - update all visible components

element.name: TApplication.DoIdleActions
element.short: DoIdleActions - perform the actions that remain idle

element.name: TApplication.MenuPopupHandler
element.short: MenuPopupHandler - method for dealing with menu popups

element.name: TApplication.ProcessAsyncCallQueue
element.short: ProcessAsyncCallQueue - method to process a queue of asynchronous calls

element.name: TApplication.FreeComponent
element.short: FreeComponent - method for freeing a component

element.name: TApplication.DoBeforeFinalization
element.short: DoBeforeFinalization - the things to be done before finalisation of the application

element.name: TApplication.Create
element.descr: This instance of the constructor performs most of the setting up of the environment for the application. The instances of Create that occur in some of the ancestor classes are place holders rather than actual instructions for constructing the object
element.short: Create - constructor for TApplication: initialises a large number of local variables and properties, then calls inherited Create

element.name: TApplication.Create.AOwner
element.short: The Owner object that invoked this instance of TApplication

element.name: TApplication.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TApplication: frees various handles and flags, then cals inherited Destroy

element.name: TApplication.ControlDestroyed
element.short: Method for dealing with a control that has been destroyed

element.name: TApplication.BringToFront
element.short: BringToFront - Use the selected widget set's method to bring the application's form(s) to the front

element.name: TApplication.CreateForm
element.short: Create Form or any other kind of component
element.descr:
Note: The name is confusing and only kept for Delphi compatibility.
It can actually create any kind of component
Creates a Component instance, sets the pointer to the component variable and loads the component.
If it is a form it will be added to the application's forms list

element.name: TApplication.UpdateMainForm
element.short: UpdateMainForm - update the Application's main form

element.name: TApplication.QueueAsyncCall
element.short: Insert a given asynchronous call into the queue
element.descr: This is thread safe.

element.name: TApplication.QueueAsyncCall.AMethod
element.short: The method to be used for the asynchronous call

element.name: TApplication.QueueAsyncCall.Data
element.short: The data structure used by the asynchronous call method

element.name: TApplication.ReleaseComponent
element.short: ReleaseComponent - method to release the specified component

element.name: TApplication.ExecuteAction
element.descr: This is a function that should be supplied by the application programmer, to override the placeholders declared in ancestor classes
element.short: ExecuteAction - calls the OnActionExecute event hndler if it is assigned

element.name: TApplication.UpdateAction
element.short: UpdateAction - calls the OnUpdateAction event handler if it is assigned

element.name: TApplication.HandleException
element.descr:
Individual exception handler methods should be supplied by the application programmer, to override place-holder entries declared in ancestor classes.
This method checks whether the application is required to halt if an exception occurs, or invokes the appropriate handler.
It also writes details of the exception to the appropriate place for debugging.
element.short: HandleException method for handling an exception; attempts to maintain program execution if possible, otherwise exits gracefully

element.name: TApplication.HandleMessage
element.short: Process all events according to the method defined for the widget set

element.name: TApplication.HelpContext
element.short: HelpContext - returns True if there is a specified context-dependent help message associated with the application, with an optionally specified position

element.name: TApplication.HelpKeyword
element.short: HelpKeyword - returns True if there is a specified help keyword associated with the application, with an optionally specified position

element.name: TApplication.ShowHelpForObject
element.short: ShowHelpForObject - method for displaying help messages

element.name: TApplication.HideAllFormsWithStayOnTop
element.short: HideAllFormsWithStayOnTop - hide all forms, but keep the curent top form on top

element.name: TApplication.IsWaiting
element.short: IsWaiting - returns True if the application is awainting an event

element.name: TApplication.CancelHint
element.short: Cancels a request for a hint, if there is no hint timer or no hint to display

element.name: TApplication.HideHint
element.short: Don't display the hint

element.name: TApplication.HintMouseMessage
element.short: HintMouseMessage - method to find the hint for the control at the mouse position

element.name: TApplication.Icon
element.short: The icon to be associated with this application

element.name: TApplication.Initialize
element.descr: Finds the appropriate widget set, reads the application's icon (if any) from the Lazarus Resource file, initialises the screen, and leaves it ready for processing.
element.short: Initialize - calls inherited Initialize, then initialises widget set, loads icons from Laz resources and updates screen

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox
element.short: Message Box: a useful function to display a message.

descr.p: MessageBox: a useful function to display a message.

The function is used internally to display messages during the handling of Exceptions , but is also available to application programmers as an alternative to some of the message dialogs found in Dialogs
The argument Flags is a long integer constructed by adding together various constants to define the contents and behaviour of the box, for example:
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE + MR_ICONQUESTION will cause the application to display a query (?) icon in a box with three buttons:
ABORT RETRY IGNORE.
The following button constants are available:
MB_OK
MB_OKCANCEL
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE
MB_YESNOCANCEL
MB_YESNO
MB_RETRYCANCEL
And the following icon constants:
MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONQUESTION
MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONASTERICK
MB_ICONWARNING = MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONERROR = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONSTOP = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONINFORMATION = MB_ICONASTERICK
These constants are declared on the LCLType unit.
The function returns an integer value corresponding to the button that was pressed; its value can be determined by reference to the constants [IDOK..IDHELP]
It can be invoked like a procedure call (ie as a 'MessageBox()' statement rather than as a 'Variable := MessageBox()' function call)

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Result
element.short: Result
element.descr:
Result: integer value returned by the function to signify which box was selected
Can be one of the following values:
IDOK
IDCANCEL
IDABORT
IDRETRY
IDIGNORE
IDYES
IDNO
IDCLOSE
IDHELP

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Text
element.short: Text: the string that is displayed as a prompt or instruction in the Box

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Caption
element.short: Caption: the string label at the top of the message box

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Flags
element.short: Flags - a long integer constructed by adding together various constants to define the contents and behaviour of the box
element.descr:
Flags: longint - an integer constructed by adding together various constants to define the contents and behaviour of the box, for example
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE + MR_ICONQUESTION will cause the application to display a query (?) icon in a box with three buttons:
ABORT RETRY IGNORE.
The following button constants are available:
MB_OK
MB_OKCANCEL
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE
MB_YESNOCANCEL
MB_YESNO
MB_RETRYCANCEL
And the following icon constants:
MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONQUESTION
MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONASTERICK
MB_ICONWARNING = MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONERROR = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONSTOP = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONINFORMATION = MB_ICONASTERICK
These constants are declared on the LCLType unit.

element.name: TApplication.Minimize
element.short: Minimise the form using the widget set's method

element.name: TApplication.Restore
element.short: Restore the application's form to the size it was before minimisation or maximisation

element.name: TApplication.Notification
element.short: Notification if Operation is Remove, then sets any Component to nil, otherwise calls inherited Notification

element.name: TApplication.ProcessMessages
element.short: ProcessMessages - method for processing system messages

element.name: TApplication.Idle
element.short: Idle - method for rendering the Application Idle if Wait is True

element.name: TApplication.Run
element.descr: This method should be supplied by the application programmer, and should be the main process control procedure for the application

element.name: TApplication.ShowException.E
element.short: The exception that is to be displayed

element.name: TApplication.DisableIdleHandler
element.short: DisableIdleHandler - turn off the Idle handler

element.name: TApplication.EnableIdleHandler
element.short: EnableIdleHandler - turn on the Idle handler

element.name: TApplication.NotifyUserInputHandler
element.short: NotifyUserInputHandler - send message t handler for user input

element.name: TApplication.NotifyKeyDownBeforeHandler
element.short: NotifyKeyDownBeforeHandler - send message to handler for the condition where a key has been previously pressed (eg a Shift, Control or Alt key(

element.name: TApplication.NotifyKeyDownHandler
element.short: NotifyKeyDownHandler - sends message to handler for a key pressed down

element.name: TApplication.ControlKeyDown
element.short: ControlKeyDown - method for dealing with the Control Key being pressed down

element.name: TApplication.ControlKeyUp
element.short: ControlKeyUp - method for dealing with a released Control key

element.short: AddOnIdleHandler - method for adding a handler for the Idle state

element.short: RemoveOnIdleHandler - method for removing a handler for the Idle state

element.short: AddOnIdleEndHandler - method to add a handler for the end of the Idle state

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnIdleEndHandler
element.short: RemoveOnIdleEndHandler - method for removing handler for the end of the Idle state

element.name: TApplication.AddOnUserInputHandler
element.short: AddOnUserInputHandler - method for adding a handler for user input

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnUserInputHandler
element.short: RemoveOnUserInputHandler - method for removing handler for user input

element.name: TApplication.AddOnKeyDownBeforeHandler
element.short: AddOnKeyDownBeforeHandler - method for adding handler for the state where a key (eg Ctrl, Shift, Alt) has been already pressed

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnKeyDownBeforeHandler
element.short: RemoveOnKeyDownBeforeHandler - method for removing handler for the state where a key (eg Ctrl, Shift, Alt) has been already pressed

element.name: TApplication.AddOnKeyDownHandler
element.short: AddOnKeyDownHandler - method for adding a handler for the Key Down state

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnKeyDownHandler
element.short: RemoveOnKeyDownHandler - method for removing handler for the Key Down state

element.name: TApplication.AddOnActivateHandler
element.short: AddOnActivateHandler - method for adding a handler for activation

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnActivateHandler
element.short: RemoveOnActivateHandler - method for removing handler for activation

element.name: TApplication.AddOnDeactivateHandler
element.short: AddOnDeactivateHandler - method for adding handler for deactivation

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnDeactivateHandler
element.short: RemoveOnDeactivateHandler - method for removing deactivation handler

element.name: TApplication.AddOnExceptionHandler
element.short: AddOnExceptionHandler - method for adding exception handler

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnExceptionHandler
element.short: RemoveOnExceptionHandler - method for removing exception handler

element.name: TApplication.AddOnEndSessionHandler
element.short: AddOnEndSessionHandler - method for adding handler for end of session

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnEndSessionHandler
element.short: RemoveOnEndSessionHandler - method for removing handler for end of session

element.name: TApplication.AddOnQueryEndSessionHandler
element.short: AddOnQueryEndSessionHandler - method for adding handler for a query at the end of a session

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnQueryEndSessionHandler
element.short: RemoveOnQueryEndSessionHandler - method for removing handler for a query at the end of a session

element.name: TApplication.AddOnMinimizeHandler
element.short: AddOnMinimizeHandler - method for adding handler for minimising component

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnMinimizeHandler
element.short: RemoveOnMinimizeHandler - method to remove handler for maximising component

element.name: TApplication.AddOnRestoreHandler
element.short: AddOnRestoreHandler - method to add handler for Restore component

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnRestoreHandler
element.short: RemoveOnRestoreHandler - method to remove restore handler

element.name: TApplication.AddOnDropFilesHandler
element.short: AddOnDropFilesHandler - method to add handler for dropped files

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnDropFilesHandler
element.short: RemoveOnDropFilesHandler - method for removing drop files handler

element.name: TApplication.AddOnHelpHandler
element.short: AddOnHelpHandler - method to add Help handler

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnHelpHandler
element.short: RemoveOnHelpHandler - method to remove Help handler

element.name: TApplication.AddOnHintHandler
element.short: AddOnHintHandler - method to add handler for Hints

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnHintHandler
element.short: RemoveOnHintHandler - method to remove Hint handler

element.name: TApplication.AddOnShowHintHandler
element.short: AddOnShowHintHandler - method to add handler for showing Hints

element.name: TApplication.RemoveOnShowHintHandler
element.short: RemoveOnShowHintHandler - method for removing handler for showing Hints

element.name: TApplication.RemoveAllHandlersOfObject
element.short: RemoveAllHandlersOfObject - method to remove all handlers of an object

element.name: TApplication.DoBeforeMouseMessage
element.short: DoBeforeMouseMessage - things to be done before a mouse message is processed

element.name: TApplication.IsShortcut
element.short: IsShortcut - returns True if specified Keyi s a shortcut

element.name: TApplication.IntfQueryEndSession
element.short: IntfQueryEndSession - called by the interface when there is a query at the end of a session

element.name: TApplication.IntfEndSession
element.short: IntfEndSession - called by the interface at the end of a session

element.name: TApplication.IntfAppMinimize
element.short: IntfAppMinimize - called by the interface if an application is minimised

element.name: TApplication.IntfAppRestore
element.short: IntfAppRestore - called by the interface when an application is being restored

element.name: TApplication.IntfDropFiles
element.short: IntfDropFiles - called by the interface for dropping files

element.name: TApplication.DoEscapeKey
element.short: DoEscapeKey - method for processing the Escape key

element.name: TApplication.DoReturnKey
element.short: DoReturnKey - method for processing the Return (Enter) key

element.name: TApplication.DoTabKey
element.short: DoTabKey - method for processing the Tab key

element.name: TApplication.Active
element.short: Active - returns True if this is an active Application

element.name: TApplication.CaptureExceptions
element.short: CaptureExceptions - If exceptions have occurred, find out what they are, ready for processing

element.name: TApplication.FindGlobalComponentEnabled
element.short: FindGlobalComponentEnabled - returns True if the Find Global Component state is enabled

element.name: TApplication.Flags
element.short: Flags - the list of flags for this application

element.name: TApplication.Hint
element.short: The hint associated with the main application
element.descr:
A hint is a small pop-up mesage that appears briefly while the mouse hovers over a specified area of the screen. It usually displays useful information about how to use an object or what data should be entered, etc
Reads or writes a flag to determine the hint associated with the application

element.name: TApplication.HintColor
element.short: The colour used to display the hint

element.name: TApplication.HintHidePause
element.short: The delay period after mouse entry before the hint becomes visible

element.name: TApplication.HintHidePausePerChar
element.short: HintHidePausePerChar - the pause period per character for hiding a hint

element.name: TApplication.HintPause
element.short: HintPause - The length of time for which the hint is displayed

element.name: TApplication.HintShortCuts
element.short: HintShortCuts - If True, there are hints for short cut keys

element.name: TApplication.HintShortPause
element.short: HintShortPause - the pause before a shortcut hint is displayed

element.name: TApplication.Navigation
element.short: Determine how the form is to be navigated
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the navigation method:
Is Tab used to move to next control?
Does Enter or Ret activate the default action?
Does Esc perform the cancel action?
Does F1 activate a Help system?
Navigation Options is a set, so can take zero or more of the available values

element.name: TApplication.MainForm
element.short: The Main Form used by the application for process control and for data input/output
element.descr: Reads a flag to get particulars of the main form

element.name: TApplication.OnActionExecute
element.short: OnActionExecute - event handler for executing the application's main action

element.name: TApplication.OnActionUpdate
element.short: OnActionUpdate - event handler for updating the application's main action

element.name: TApplication.OnActivate
element.short: OnActivate - Event handler for activation of the application

element.name: TApplication.OnDeactivate
element.short: OnDeactivate - Event handler for deactivation of the application

element.name: TApplication.OnIdle
element.short: OnIdle - event handler for the Idle state

element.name: TApplication.OnIdleEnd
element.short: OnIdleEnd - event handler for the end of the Idle state

element.name: TApplication.OnEndSession
element.short: OnEndSession - Event handler for ending a session of the application

element.name: TApplication.OnQueryEndSession
element.short: OnQueryEndSession - event handler for processing a query at the end of a session

element.name: TApplication.OnMinimize
element.short: OnMinimize - Event handler for minimising the application's form

element.name: TApplication.OnRestore
element.short: OnRestore - Event handler for restoring the application's form from minimised or maximised condition

element.name: TApplication.OnDropFiles
element.short: OnDropFiles - The event invoked when file is dropped on one of the application forms.
element.descr: The OnDropFiles event is invoked when user drops one or multiple files on one of the application forms. You must enable this feature by setting AllowDropFiles property of form.

element.name: TApplication.OnHelp
element.short: OnHelp - Event handler when help is required

element.name: TApplication.OnHint
element.short: OnHint - Event handler when a hint is required

element.name: TApplication.OnShortcut
element.short: OnShortcut - Event handler when a shortcut key is pressed

element.name: TApplication.OnShowHint
element.short: OnShowHint - Event handler for showing a hint

element.name: TApplication.OnUserInput
element.short: OnUserInput - Event handler when user input is required or is occurring

element.name: TApplication.OnDestroy
element.short: OnDestroy - Event handler for destruction of the application

element.name: TApplication.ShowHint
element.short: ShowHint - Is a hint required to be shown?

element.name: TApplication.ShowMainForm
element.short: ShowMainForm - Is the main form for the application to be shown? Default TRUE

element.name: TApplication.ApplicationType
element.short: ApplicationType - The type of the application (ie the sort of device for which it is intended)

descr.p: The type of the application:
Default, Desktop, Handheld, PDA, Smartphone

element.name: TApplicationProperties
element.short: TApplicationProperties: The properties of the current application

descr.p: TApplication Properties can be set as a local default set of properties to be used for any new instance fo TApplication

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetCaptureExceptions
element.short: SetCaptureExceptions - specifies whether exceptions are to be captured

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetHelpFile
element.short: SetHelpFile - specifies which file is to be used for Help messages

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetHint
element.short: SetHint - specifies the text for a Hint

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetHintColor
element.short: SetHintColor - specifies the colour for displaying hints

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetHintHidePause
element.short: SetHintHidePause - specifies the length of pause before a hint becomes hidden

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetHintPause
element.short: SetHintPause - specifies the length of pause before a hint is displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetHintShortCuts
element.short: SetHintShortCuts - specifies whether hints are to be displayed for Shortcut keys

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetHintShortPause
element.short: SetHintShortPause - specifies the length of pause before a shortcut key hint is displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetShowHint
element.short: SetShowHint - specifies whether hints are to be displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetTitle
element.short: SetTitle - specifies the title for the Form

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnException
element.short: SetOnException - specifies the event handler for exceptions

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnIdle
element.short: SetOnIdle - specifies the handler for Idle events

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnIdleEnd
element.short: SetOnIdleEnd - specifies the handler to notify the end of an idle period

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnEndSession
element.short: SetOnEndSession - specifies the event handler to notify the end of a session

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnQueryEndSession
element.short: SetOnQueryEndSession - specify the event handler for a query at the end of a session

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnMinimize
element.short: SetOnMinimize - specify the event handler for minimising the application form

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnRestore
element.short: SetOnRestore - specify the event handler for restoring the application's form

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnDropFiles
element.short: SetOnDropFiles - specify the event handler for dropping files

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnHelp
element.short: SetOnHelp - specify the event handler for help requests

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnHint
element.short: SetOnHint - specify the event handler for a request to show hints

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnShowHint
element.short: SetOnShowHint - specify the event handler for showing hints

element.name: TApplicationProperties.SetOnUserInput
element.short: SetOnUserInput - specify the event handler for dealing with User input

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TApplicationProperties: calls inherited Create, then sets some defaults if new application is being designed, or loads local values from existing application

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TApplicationProperties: removes a number of handlers then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TApplicationProperties.CaptureExceptions
element.short: CaptureExceptions - Determine whether exceptions are being captured
element.descr: Boolean property (true if exceptions are being captured); reads or writes flag to see if they are being captured

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HelpFile
element.short: HelpFile - Determines which file to use for Help
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine name of Help file - name is stored as a string

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Hint
element.short: Hint - Determines Hint to be used
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine Hint - stored as a string

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintColor
element.short: HintColor - Colour to be used when displaying Hint
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine Hint colour (stored as a TColor integer)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintHidePause
element.short: HintHidePause - the length of pause before a hint becomes hidden

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintPause
element.short: HintPause - the length of pause before a hint is displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintShortCuts
element.short: HintShortCuts - the hints for shortcut keys (present if True)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintShortPause
element.short: HintShortPause - the length of pause before a shortcut hint is displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowHint
element.short: ShowHint - Determines whether a hint is to be displayed
element.descr: Read or write flag to determine whether to display hint (stored as boolean, True if hint is to be displayed)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowMainForm
element.short: ShowMainForm - Determines whether main form is to be displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Title
element.short: Title to be shown in Application's top Border

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnException
element.short: OnException - Event handler for exceptions

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnIdle
element.short: OnIdle - event handler for the Idle state

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnIdleEnd
element.short: OnIdleEnd - event handler for the end of the Idle state

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnEndSession
element.short: OnEndSession - Event handler for the end of the session

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnQueryEndSession
element.short: OnQueryEndSession - Event handler for a query at the end of a session

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnMinimize
element.short: OnMinimize - Event handler for minimising the form

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnRestore
element.short: OnRestore - Event handler for restoring a form which has been minimised or maximised

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnDropFiles
element.short: OnDropFiles - Event handler when files are dropped on the form

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnHelp
element.short: OnHelp - Event handler when help is needed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnHint
element.short: OnHint - Event handler when a hint is needed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnShowHint
element.short: OnShowHint - Event handler for showing a hint

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnUserInput
element.short: OnUserInput - Event handler when user input is received

element.name: TIDesigner.IsDesignMsg
element.short: IsDesignMsg - receives a message from Sender, and returns True if it is a design message

element.name: TIDesigner.Modified
element.short: Method when design is Modified

element.name: TIDesigner.Notification
element.short: Notification that the suppied Operation has been applied to the specified Component

element.name: TIDesigner.PaintGrid
element.short: PaintGrid - method for painting the grid in the designer

element.name: TIDesigner.ValidateRename
element.short: ValidateRename - method to validate the Rename process

element.name: TIDesigner.GetShiftState
element.short: GetShiftState - returns the value of the shift state (whether shifted, Cntl key, Alt key etc)

element.name: TIDesigner.SelectOnlyThisComponent
element.short: SelectOnlyThisComponent - method to select only the currrent component in the designer

element.name: TIDesigner.UniqueName
element.short: UniqueName - returns a Unique name for the designer, using the BaseName as a starting point

element.name: TFormPropertyStorage
element.short: TFormPropertyStorage - class for storage of a Form's properties

element.name: TDataModule
element.short: Data Module
element.descr: Data Module: for interfacing to the database

element.name: KeysToShiftState
element.short: KeysToShiftState - converts an actual physical key code to a shift state (ie Shift, Ctrl, Alt etc)

element.name: KeyDataToShiftState
element.short: KeyDataToShiftState - converts Key data to a shift state

element.name: WindowStateToStr
element.short: WindowStateToStr - converts a Window state to a string

element.name: StrToWindowState
element.short: StrToWindowState - converts a string to a Window state

element.name: TMessageBoxFunction
element.short: TMessageBoxFunction - the function to be used by a message box: specifies Text and Flags, and returns an integer value

element.name: TForm.LCLVersion
element.short: The version of the LCL as string. Used to distinguish form streams of different versions.

element.name: TScreen.DataModuleCount
element.short: The number of data modules on the screen

element.name: TScreen.DataModules
element.short: The list of Data Modules

element.name: TCustomFrame.DefineProperties
element.short: DefineProperties- calculates low and high values for frame design from ancestor class

element.name: TCustomForm.BigIconHandle
element.short: BigIconHandle - returns system Handle for large Icon

element.name: TCustomForm.SmallIconHandle
element.short: SmallIconHandle - returns system Handle for small Icon

element.name: TCustomForm.GetFormImage
element.short: GetFormImage - gets a Bitmap image for the Form

element.name: TScreen.FindDataModule
element.short: FindDataModule - returns the Data Module with the specified name

element.name: TApplication.GetParams
element.short: GetParams - find the application's parameters (typically by parsing the command line that invoked the application)

element.name: TApplication.BigIconHandle
element.short: BigIconHandle - system Handle for large Icon

element.name: TApplication.SmallIconHandle
element.short: SmallIconHandle - system handle for small Icon

element.name: TApplication.BidiMode
element.short: BidiMode - whether bi-directional mode is available

element.name: TCustomForm.DoShowWindow
element.short: DoShowWindow automatically choose a control to focus

element.name: TCustomForm.AdjustClientRect
element.short: AdjustClientRect - adjusts window size to accommodate borders

element.name: TScreen.DisableForms
element.short: DisableForms - disable all forms except SkipForm. If DisabledList is available then add forms to that list and return it, otherwise return new list. Used to show forms and other dialogs modal

element.name: TScreen.EnableForms
element.short: EnableForms - enable all forms from AFormList and destroy list. Used to restore state after DisableForms

element.name: TApplication.DoArrowKey
element.short: DoArrowKey - method for processing an arrow key

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowButtonGlyphs
element.short: ShowButtonGlyphs - determines whether to show show or not glyphs on TBitBtn controls
element.descr:
This option allows to set rule for all application TBitBtn controls which have GlyphShowMode = gsmApplication.
Different operation systems has different preferences regards showing button glyphs. Mac OS X and Windows UI guidlines suggests not to use them. Gnome has a special theme setting for this. sbgSystem option allows application to use system preferences for glyphs showing. sbgAlways is the default value because of Delphi compatibility.

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowMenuGlyphs
element.short: ShowMenuGlyphs - Deturmines whether show or not glyphs in menu
element.descr:
This option allows to set rule for all application TMenuItem components which have GlyphShowMode = gsmApplication.
Different operation systems has different preferences regards showing images in menus. Mac OS X suggests not to use them. Gnome has a special theme setting for this. sbgSystem option allows application to use system preferences for menu icons showing. sbgAlways is the default value because of Delphi compatibility.

element.name: TApplicationShowGlyphs
element.short: TApplicationShowGlyphs - enumerated type to describe the glyphs showing rule - whether to show them always, never or depends on system settings

descr.p: sbgAlways - show glyphs always (inspite of system preferences)
sbgNever - show glyphs never (inspite of system preferences)
sbgSystem - use system preferences for glyphs showing

element.name: TMonitor
element.short: TMonitor - system monitor
element.descr: TMonitor contains properties to access visible and work dimensions of the system monitor.

element.name: TMonitor.Handle
element.short: Hanlde - system handle of monitor

element.name: TMonitor.MonitorNum
element.short: MonitorNum - index of the monitor in the screen monitors list

element.name: TMonitor.Left
element.short: Left - the logical position of the left side of the monitor

element.name: TMonitor.Height
element.short: Height - the logical height of the monitor

element.name: TMonitor.Top
element.short: Top - the logical position of the top side of the monitor

element.name: TMonitor.Width
element.short: Width - the logical width of the monitor

element.name: TMonitor.BoundsRect
element.short: BoundsRect - the logical dimensions of the monitor

element.name: TMonitor.WorkareaRect
element.short: WorkareaRect - the logical dimensions of the monitor except the unusable parts (like the taskbar, the dockbar, the global menu)

element.name: TMonitor.Primary
element.short: Primary - indicates whether this monitor is primary

element.name: TMonitorList
element.short: TMonitorList - a list of monitors

element.name: TScreen.MonitorCount
element.short: MonitorCount - returns a number of monitors

element.name: TScreen.Monitors
element.short: Monitors - provides access to the monitor list array

element.name: TScreen.PrimaryMonitor
element.short: PrimaryMonitor - return the primary monitor of the system

element.name: TCustomForm.Monitor
element.short: Monitor - returns the monitor on which the form is mostly places (the biggest form area is placed)

element.name: TDefaultMonitor
element.short: TDefaultMonitor - enumerated type to specify on which monitor to place the form
element.descr: dmDesktop - don't change the form position (use the full desktop) dmPrimary - place the form on the primary monitor dmMainForm - place the form on the same monitor as the main form. If there is no main form then use dmPrimary behavior. dmActiveForm - place the form on the same monitor as the current active form. If there is no active form use dmMainForm behavior.

element.name: TApplication.RemoveAsyncCalls
element.short: Removes all calls added via QueueAsyncCall
element.descr: This is thread safe.
